Lufthansino kabinsko osebje začelo dvodnevno stavko
07 Nov 2019, 08:52 by STA

Kabinsko osebje nemškega letalskega prevoznika Lufthansa je opolnoči začelo 48-urno stavko. Družba je odpovedala 1300 letov, prizadetih bo 180.000 potnikov. Na ljubljanskem letališču zaradi stavke v sredo pozno popoldne še ni bil odpovedan noben let, so za STA pojasnili v družbi Fraport Slovenija, ki upravlja z letališčem.




FRANKFURT > Za danes je Lufthansa zaradi stavke odpovedala 700 letov, za petek pa 600. Večinoma gre za lete iz Nemčije.
Potnikom, ki imajo vozovnico za let v času stavke, prevoznik ponuja možnost brezplačne menjave za drug let v prihodnjih desetih dneh. Za lete v Nemčiji ponujajo tudi menjavo za vozovnico za vlak.
Pri letih z Letališča Jožeta Pučnika Ljubljana za četrtek in petek v sredo pozno popoldne ni bilo napovedanih sprememb, tako da naj bi lete - dvakrat dnevno v Frankfurt in enkrat dnevno v München - izvedli po planu.
Sindikat Ufo, ki zastopa Lufthansino kabinsko osebje, je k stavki pozval v ponedeljek. Lufthansa je svoje zadnje upe polagala na delovno sodišče v Frankfurtu, kamor je vložila zahtevo za prepoved stavke, a jo je sodišče zavrnilo.
Lufthansa se je na delovno sodišče obrnila že pred časom, da bi dobila mnenje o tem, ali je Ufo še pristojen za dogovarjanje o kolektivni spremembi plač. Po mnenju letalskega prevoznika je sindikat po odhodu številnih članov zaradi notranjih sporov izgubil reprezentativnost.

Lufthansa's cabin crew began a two-day strike
07 Nov 2019, 08:52 by STA

The cabin crew of the German airline Lufthansa launched a 48-hour strike at midnight. The company has canceled 1,300 flights and 180,000 passengers will be affected. No flights were canceled at the Ljubljana airport late Wednesday afternoon, Fraport Slovenia, which operates the airport, told STA.




FRANKFURT> For today, Lufthansa canceled 700 flights because of the strike and 600 flights on Friday. Most of them are flights from Germany.
Passengers who hold a flight ticket at the time of the strike are offered the option of a free change of flight for another flight within the next ten days. For flights in Germany, they also offer an exchange for a train ticket.
No changes were announced for flights from Ljubljana Jože Pučnik Airport on Thursday and Friday late Wednesday afternoon, so that flights - twice a day to Frankfurt and once a day to Munich - should be scheduled.
The Ufo union, which represents Lufthansa's cabin crew, called for a strike on Monday. Lufthansa laid her last hopes on the Frankfurt Labor Court, where she filed a motion to ban the strike, but was rejected by the court.
Lufthansa approached the Labor Court a long time ago to get an opinion on whether Ufo is still competent to agree on a collective wage change. According to the airline, the union lost its representativeness after leaving many members due to internal disputes.
